pages.text: $(item)Conduits/$ can transport $(thing)elements/$ from one place to another, and can even duplicate them if the $(thing)element/$ travels through a branch.

These $(thing)elements/$ behave in a manner similar to a cellular automata called $(l:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wireworld)Wireworld/$.$(br2)In short, $(thing)elements/$ will spread to adjacent conduits, and are followed by a "tail". If three of the same $(thing)element/$ meet, they cancel each other out. Be careful, though; if different $(thing)elements/$ meet, a (possibly destructive) reaction occurs.
